result.execSummary:
The defendant Juliette Marie Watkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:46 p.m. Defendant Juliette Marie Watkins in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: 45 days WC Jail - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than May 15, 2016, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, $170 Drug Buy Money w/ 60 DTP or PP, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
Defendant's Motion and Order to Adjourn Plea/Sentencing

NOT PUT ON THE RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Any prescription needs to be in the quantity prescribed.

2:33 pm case called. Defendant Juliette Marie Watkins in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause, and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters a Not Guilty plea to all counts.    STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 09:45 am.
from DA's Office with attached drug buy money reimbursement request - $170
